intro: Corydalis solida subsp. solida, commonly known as the solid corydalis, is a flowering plant in the family Fumariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, particularly in countries like Italy, France, and Spain. The plant produces delicate, spurred flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, and it has a fibrous root system. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
